Package com.amonson.xdg

Class Xdg

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amonson.xdg.Xdg
  • public class Xdg
extends java.lang.Object

    Class used to open files based loosely on the XDG specification. The specification is located at https://specifications.freedesktop.org/basedir-spec/basedir-spec-latest.html. The following features of the specification are supported:

    • Data home folder
    • Data search path
    • Configuration home folder
    • Configuration search path
    • Cache directory (temporary files that are not sensitive)

    The only feature not supported is the runtime directory (XDG_RUNTIME_DIR) for temporary files that are user sensitive.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Xdg()
      Create a non-specific version of the Xdg class that will not use a application name as a subfolder.
      Xdg​(java.lang.String applicationName)
      Create a specific version of the Xdg class that will use a application name as a subfolder.

      • Xdg

        public Xdg​(java.lang.String applicationName)
        Create a specific version of the Xdg class that will use a application name as a subfolder.
        Parameters:
        applicationName - The name to use as an application subfolder to the base XDG specification defined folder.

    • Method Detail

      • openDataInputStream

        public java.io.InputStream openDataInputStream​(java.lang.String fileNameOnly)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Open a XDG data input stream if found in the XDG_DATA_DIRS path. The XDG_DATA_HOME is the first priority if specified.
        Parameters:
        fileNameOnly - The name to find in the data path (XDG_DATA_DIRS).
        Returns:
        The InputStream object if successful.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When the file cannot be opened or is missing.
